title: An Idealistic Cop, a Forbidden Ticket and a Police Career on the Brink
description: Mathew Bianchi took routine traffic stops seriously and handed out tickets regardless of people’s connections within the Police Department. He says he was punished for it.
content: The courtesy cards that police officers handed out to friends and relatives to help them avoid traffic tickets always rubbed Mathew Bianchi the wrong way.
author: Jonah E. Bromwich

title: Putin Is Making His Plans Brutally Clear
description: Ukrainians know that when it comes to Vladimir Putin, one must not trust what he says, but watch what he does.
author: Nataliya Gumenyuk

title: Even the Battle for Second Turned Out Well for Trump in Iowa
description: A dominant victory and little momentum for his rivals.
content: Donald Trump won by 30 percentage points.
author: Nate Cohn

title: 2023 Emmys: Best and Worst Moments From the Awards Show
description: Most of the awards on Monday night went to favored shows like “Succession” and “The Bear.” But the ceremony, delayed from September, still had a few surprises.
content: The “Succession” creator Jesse Armstrong, right foreground, accepted the award for best drama on Monday, the third time the series has won the award.
author: The New York Times

title: Israeli Teenager Recounts Her Time as a Hostage in Gaza
description: Hila Rotem Shoshani, 13, is the youngest of the hostages freed from Gaza to speak out about the harsh conditions in which they were held.
content: Hila Rotem Shoshani, 13, in New York on Friday. She was 12 when she, her mother and her 8-year-old friend were abducted from Kibbutz Be’eri on Oct. 7.
author: Nadav Gavrielov

title: How Trump’s Opponents Made Iowa Easy for Him
description: It’s absurd that there was no unified opposition candidate again.
author: Ross Douthat

title: Covid, Crutches, Surgery: For Christopher Abbott the Show Somehow Went On
description: “I thought this could be my swan song, in terms of the angry-young-man thing,” said the actor of his rocky run of “Danny and the Deep Blue Sea.”
content: Christopher Abbott, a star of “Danny and the Deep Blue Sea,” posing in his dressing room at the Lucille Lortel Theater. He used crutches onstage after injuring his knee during a December performance.
author: Michael Paulson
tags: Danny and the Deep Blue Sea (Play)

title: The Emmys Signal the End of the Peak TV Era
description: The Emmys on Monday night felt in many ways like a bookend to one of the defining features of the streaming era: a never-ending supply of new programming.
content: The cast of “Succession,” one of the big winners at the Emmys on Monday.
author: John Koblin

title: The U.S. Lacks What Every Democracy Needs
description: We should amend the Constitution to grant an affirmative right to vote.
author: Richard L. Hasen

title: Migrant Costs Help Push New York State’s Budget to $233 Billion
description: Gov. Kathy Hochul’s new spending plan, unveiled on Tuesday, also called for investments in mental health care and for an important change to the way that cannabis is taxed.
content: Gov. Kathy Hochul floated two changes to education policy, including one that would double the length of Mayor Eric Adams’s control of New York City schools to four years.
author: Grace Ashford and Erin Nolan

title: Rex Heuermann Charged With Fourth Murder in Gilgo Beach Killings
description: Mr. Heuermann is accused of killing Maureen Brainard-Barnes, the last of the so-called Gilgo Four, whose bodies were found along a desolate beach.
content: Nicolette Brainard-Barnes, the daughter of Maureen Brainard-Barnes, spoke to reporters after Rex Heuermann was charged with her mother’s killing.
author: Corey Kilgannon

title: The House G.O.P.’s Incredible Shrinking Majority
description: Another Republican resignation and medical absences are cutting into the party’s already shaky hold on the chamber.
content: House Republicans are facing a slim majority as member numbers shrink.
author: Carl Hulse

title: Trump Left Iowa With Momentum and a Court Date
description: Also, the U.S. struck Houthi targets for a third time. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.
content: Donald Trump arrived in New York after the Iowa caucuses.
author: Matthew Cullen

title: ABC News Cancels G.O.P. Debate After Haley Demands Trump Appear, Too
description: Nikki Haley said she would not agree to more debates unless Donald Trump was onstage with her. Another debate, on CNN, was in doubt before the New Hampshire primary next week.
content: Nikki Haley at a watch party in Des Moines on Monday.
author: Neil Vigdor and Chris Cameron

title: Nikki Haley Looks to New Hampshire Primary With a Focus on Independents
description: The former South Carolina governor has banked her campaign on the state, buoyed by an influx of cash and an advertising blitz as she looks to rebound from Iowa.
content: Nikki Haley had a disappointing third-place finish in Iowa. Now, she hopes to rebound in New Hampshire, where she has focused much of her effort.
author: Nick Corasaniti

title: Biden Invites Congressional Leaders to White House to Discuss Aid to Ukraine
description: President Biden’s request for more than $110 billion in assistance for Ukraine, Israel and the border, has been held up by a dispute with Republicans on Capitol Hill.
content: President Biden invited congressional leadership to the White House to discuss military aid and immigration.
author: Erica L. Green and Michael D. Shear

title: Christina Applegate’s Resilience Battling MS Shone Through at the Emmys
description: The actress referenced her chronic illness with humor — as a defense mechanism and a disarmament.
content: Ms. Applegate used a cane as she walked to present at the 75th Emmy awards.
author: Stella Bugbee

title: Mayor Adams Unveils $109 Billion NYC Budget With Fewer Cuts
description: Proposing a $109 billion-dollar budget, Mayor Eric Adams said that New York City’s financial outlook had improved, but he still called for more federal funding to help pay for the migrant crisis.
content: “We are not out of the woods,” said Mayor Eric Adams, with Sheena Wright, his first deputy mayor, left, and Camille Joseph Varlack, his chief of staff, right.
author: Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Jeffery C. Mays

title: Judge Blocks JetBlue From Acquiring Spirit Airlines
description: The ruling is a victory for the Justice Department, which had argued that the merger would reduce competition.
content: JetBlue announced plans in 2022 to buy Spirit for $3.8 billion. The Justice Department sued last year to prevent the deal.
author: J. Edward Moreno and Santul Nerkar

title: 4.3 Million Watched the Emmys, a New Low
description: The Emmys had a lot going against it, including a ceremony delayed months by the Hollywood strikes, and stiff competition from other events.
content: Guests attend the Governors Gala after the 75th Primetime Emmy Awards in Los Angeles.
author: John Koblin

title: U.S. Strikes Houthi Targets in Yemen for a Third Time
description: The American strikes destroyed four missiles that posed a threat to ships in the Red Sea, the Pentagon said. They came on the third day in a row the Houthis have defiantly fired at passing ships.
content: Houthi fighters rallied near Sana, Yemen, on Sunday against strikes by the United States and Britain.
author: Eric Schmitt and Saeed Al-Batati
tags: United States Defense and Military Forces

title: Food Marketing in the Ozempic Age
description: The food industry has long touted its products as impossible to resist. But with a spotlight on the perils of compulsive eating, that tactic is getting another look.
author: Kim Severson

title: For Biden, Another Trump Nomination Presents Opportunity — and Great Risk
description: Some Democrats consider the former president the Republican they would have the best chance against this fall, but also the one they most fear the consequences of losing to.
content: President Biden has made clear he is motivated by the desire to vanquish his 2020 opponent all over again.
author: Peter Baker

title: Iranian Strikes in Iraq and Pakistan Inflame Regional Tensions
description: Iran says its missile strikes were aimed at militant groups behind attacks on its territory, but Pakistan and Iraq rejected that explanation.
content: The destroyed home of Peshraw Dizayee, an Iraqi Kurdish businessman who was killed along with other members of his family in an overnight missile attack by Iran that targeted the city of Erbil, Iraq.
author: Alissa J. Rubin
tags: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

title: Bloomberg and Other Billionaires Donated to Adams’s Legal-Defense Fund
description: Mayor Eric Adams of New York set up the fund amid a broad federal corruption investigation into his campaign’s fund-raising practices.
content: A legal-defense fund for Mayor Eric Adams was started after federal investigators raided the home of his campaign’s former chief fund-raiser as part of a broad public corruption investigation.
author: Michael Rothfeld, William K. Rashbaum, Dana Rubinstein and Emma G. Fitzsimmons

title: Jury Selected in 2nd Trump Defamation Trial Brought by E. Jean Carroll
description: As E. Jean Carroll, whom Donald Trump assaulted decades ago, seeks millions to deter his verbal attacks, the former president tries to make a political virtue of his legal travails.
content: E. Jean Carroll is seeking at least $10 million in damages from former President Donald J. Trump.
author: Benjamin Weiser, Maggie Haberman, Maria Cramer and Kate Christobek

title: Macron Vows to Break France’s Taboos and Fight the Far Right
description: The president also said during a televised appearance he would fight to the last to prevent the far-right leader Marine Le Pen from succeeding him.
content: “We have had too many taboos,” President Emmanuel Macron of France said during a news conference at the Élysée Palace in Paris on Tuesday.
author: Roger Cohen

title: The Genocide Charge Against Israel Is a Moral Obscenity
description: In a war, the killing ends when one side stops fighting. In a genocide, that’s when the killing begins.
content: A house destroyed by Hamas in Kibbutz Be’eri, Israel.
author: Bret Stephens
tags: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
